trans-unit.source: Storage Analytics and Billing
trans-unit.target: Storage Analytics and Billing

trans-unit.source: This topic discusses the cost of Storage Analytics and how to use metrics and logging data to understand your storage services bill.
trans-unit.target: This topic discusses the cost of Storage Analytics and how to use metrics and logging data to understand your storage services bill.

trans-unit.source: Cost of Storage Analytics
trans-unit.target: Cost of Storage Analytics

trans-unit.source: Storage Analytics is enabled by a storage account owner; it is not enabled by default.
trans-unit.target: Storage Analytics is enabled by a storage account owner; it is not enabled by default.

trans-unit.source: All metrics data is written by the services of a storage account.
trans-unit.target: All metrics data is written by the services of a storage account.

trans-unit.source: As a result, each write operation performed by Storage Analytics is billable.
trans-unit.target: As a result, each write operation performed by Storage Analytics is billable.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, the amount of storage used by metrics data is also billable.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, the amount of storage used by metrics data is also billable.

trans-unit.source: The following actions performed by Storage Analytics are billable:
trans-unit.target: The following actions performed by Storage Analytics are billable:

trans-unit.source: Requests to create blobs for logging
trans-unit.target: Requests to create blobs for logging

trans-unit.source: Requests to create table entities for metrics
trans-unit.target: Requests to create table entities for metrics

trans-unit.source: If you have configured a data retention policy, you are not charged for delete transactions when Storage Analytics deletes old logging and metrics data.
trans-unit.target: If you have configured a data retention policy, you are not charged for delete transactions when Storage Analytics deletes old logging and metrics data.

trans-unit.source: However, delete transactions from a client are billable.
trans-unit.target: However, delete transactions from a client are billable.

trans-unit.source: For more information about retention policies, see <link xlink:href="03869817-29fb-4d56-8a9c-3995b5b4ecaa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Setting a Storage Analytics Data Retention Policy</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about retention policies, see <link xlink:href="03869817-29fb-4d56-8a9c-3995b5b4ecaa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Setting a Storage Analytics Data Retention Policy</link>.

trans-unit.source: Understanding Billable Requests
trans-unit.target: Understanding Billable Requests

trans-unit.source: Every request made to an account’s storage service is either billable or non-billable.
trans-unit.target: Every request made to an account’s storage service is either billable or non-billable.

trans-unit.source: Storage Analytics logs each individual request made to a service, including a status message that indicates how the request was handled.
trans-unit.target: Storage Analytics logs each individual request made to a service, including a status message that indicates how the request was handled.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, Storage Analytics stores metrics for both a service and the API operations of that service, including the percentages and count of certain status messages.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, Storage Analytics stores metrics for both a service and the API operations of that service, including the percentages and count of certain status messages.

trans-unit.source: Together, these features can help you analyze your billable requests, make improvements on your application, and diagnose issues with requests to your services.
trans-unit.target: Together, these features can help you analyze your billable requests, make improvements on your application, and diagnose issues with requests to your services.

trans-unit.source: For more information about billing, see <externalLink><linkText>Understanding Azure Storage Billing - Bandwidth, Transactions, and Capacity</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2010/07/09/understanding-windows-azure-storage-billing-bandwidth-transactions-and-capacity.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about billing, see <externalLink><linkText>Understanding Azure Storage Billing - Bandwidth, Transactions, and Capacity</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2010/07/09/understanding-windows-azure-storage-billing-bandwidth-transactions-and-capacity.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: When looking at Storage Analytics data, you can use the tables in the <link xlink:href="e96d4080-b09f-435c-834d-7a3ac170b602" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Storage Analytics Logged Operations and Status Messages</link> topic to determine what requests are billable.
trans-unit.target: When looking at Storage Analytics data, you can use the tables in the <link xlink:href="e96d4080-b09f-435c-834d-7a3ac170b602" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Storage Analytics Logged Operations and Status Messages</link> topic to determine what requests are billable.

trans-unit.source: Then you can compare your logs and metrics data to the status messages to see if you were charged for a particular request.
trans-unit.target: Then you can compare your logs and metrics data to the status messages to see if you were charged for a particular request.

trans-unit.source: You can also use the tables in the above topic to investigate availability for a storage service or individual API operation.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the tables in the above topic to investigate availability for a storage service or individual API operation.
